intro: Vernonia sericolepis, commonly known as silky vernonia, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters and bloom during the dry season. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
